newsitem.title: USA: INTERVIEW - Con Ed seeks 10-yr depreciation.
newsitem.headline: INTERVIEW - Con Ed seeks 10-yr depreciation.

text.p: Consolidated Edison Co of New York Inc has proposed depreciating its fossil-fueled power plants over 10 years, Vice President for Corporate Planning Kevin Burke told Reuters.

The utility's proposal for a competitive electric utility industry, filed Tuesday with state regulators, provides for accelerated depreciation of investments that might become stranded costs in a non-regulated environment.
Depreciation of natural gas, oil and coal fueled plants now averages over 30 years, Burke said.
